item.title: Report E-2024090163
item.description:
Report E-2024090163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-27
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLF experienced a UN1805 Sucrose Emprove Essential Ph Eur,BP,ChP,JP,NF release from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 10' x 28' area of the trailer floor and a 4' x 20' area of the concrete lot below. The pails were crushed by other freight due to improper loading. The contractors deployed absorbents and sodium bicarb to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents, the damaged pails, and impacted pallet wood were then collected and containerized into (5) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090164
item.description:
Report E-2024090164

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-13T09:14:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-20
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into trailer forklift operator misjudged the clearances of forkblades on the forklift and as a result they were too high and consequently struck a box already staged in the trailer puncturing an inner one gallon jug inside. The spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured fiberboard box.

item.description:
Report X-2024090628

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-03
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 30WH LITHIUM ION BATTERY PACKED WITH A DEWALT DRILL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024090245
item.description:
Report X-2024090245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Aaron Rico Supervisor called safety to report a spill in trailer 551331, UN1090, ACETONE, 3, PG II. Aaron stated it looked to be a 1-gallon Pail leaked approximately 10oz of the product in the box it is packaged in and has saturated the box. Aaron stated the pail was damaged while in transit due to not be braced or blocked correctly and fell off the pallet and fell to the floor. Aaron stated the crew found the spill while unloading trailer 551331 and stopped work to report the spill. Aaron stated the spill looks to be contained to the box it is packaged in and is still in the trailer but may h ave spilled on the trailer floor as well.~~~
